world Package¶

World Module¶

Created on Dec 20, 2014

@author: scarriere

World Class¶

class world.World.World[source]¶

Bases: builtins.object

Class that contain all the informations about the Teams, Characters and Missiles
(You can’t use any of the functions or variables that start with an “_”)
getMyTeam() → world.Team.Team[source]¶

Return the team associate with your id(int)

Exemple:

myTeam = world.getMyTeam()
getOpponentTeam() → world.Team.Team[source]¶

Return the opponent team

Exemple:

otherTeam = world.getOpponentTeam()
getTeam(teamId) → world.Team.Team[source]¶

Return the team that is associate with the given team Id(int) or None if not found

Important: the team id are not starting at 0

Exemple:

aTeam = world.getTeam(2)
isBoxAtPosition(position) → bool[source]¶

Check if there’s a box at a certain position(Vector2)

Exemple:

checkBox = world.isBoxAtPosition(Vector2(5,5))
isCharacterAtposition(position) → bool[source]¶

Check if there’s a character(Character) at a certain position(Vector2)

Exemple:

checkCharacter = world.isCharacterAtposition(Vector2(5,5))
isMissileAtPosition(position) → bool[source]¶

Check if there’s a missile(Missile) at a certain position(Vector2)

Exemple:

checkMissile = world.isMissileAtPosition(Vector2(5,5))
teams = []¶
List of all the teams
(see Team)
whatIsAtPosition(position) → world.World.Entity[source]¶

Return the Entity(Entity) at a certain position(Vector2)

Exemple:

entity = world.whatIsAtPosition(Vector2(5,5))
whatIsInTheWay(origin: mathUtils.Vector2.Vector2, direction: mathUtils.Vector2.Vector2) → {}[source]¶

Return a dict[x,y] = mapEntity between a position and a direction vector(Vector2)

Exemple:

objects = world.whatIsInTheWay(origin,
                MathUtils.getDirectionVector(origin, toPosition))

Entity Class¶

class world.World.Entity[source]¶

Bases: enum.Enum

An Enum that represent all the entity that can be found in the world
EMPTY, BOX, CHARACTER, MISSILE

Team Module¶

Created on Dec 20, 2014

@author: samuel

Team Class¶

class world.Team.Team(teamId, numberOfCharacter)[source]¶

Bases: builtins.object

Class that contain all the informations about the Team
(You can’t use any of the functions or variables that start with an “_”)
characters = None¶
List of all the characters

(see Character)

Note: The index of the characters start at 0 and the id of the character is the same as his index

getFirstCharacter()[source]¶

Return the first character(Character) of the team

Exemple:

aCharacter = aTeam.getFirstCharacter()
getSecondCharacter()[source]¶

Return the second character(Character) of the team

Exemple:

aCharacter = aTeam.getSecondCharacter()

Character Module¶

Created on Dec 20, 2014

@author: scarriere

Character Class¶

class world.Character.Character(characterId, position)[source]¶

Bases: builtins.object

Class that contain all the informations about the Character
(You can’t use any of the functions or variables that start with an “_”)
dropMine()[source]¶
Send the order to drop a mine on the current position(Vector2)
if the mine is ready

Exemple:

aCharacter.dropMine()
getPosition()[source]¶

Return the position of the character

Exemple:

position = aCharacter.getPosition()
goTo(position)[source]¶

Send the order to move the character to a certain position(Vector2)

Exemple:

aCharacter.goTo(Vector2(6,7))
isAlive()[source]¶

Check if the character still have some life point

Exemple:

checkIfAlive = aCharacter.isAlive()
life = None¶
The life total of the character
(see int)
mineReady = None¶
Is the mine ready to be use
(see bool)
missile = None¶
The missile of the character
(see Missile)
position = None¶
The current position of the character
(see Vector2)
shootMissile(direction)[source]¶
Send the order to shoot a missile on a certain direction(Direction)
if the missile is ready

Exemple:

aCharacter.shootMissile(Direction.UP)

Missile Module¶

Created on Jan 6, 2015

@author: scarriere

Missile Class¶

class world.Missile.Missile(position)[source]¶

Bases: builtins.object

Class that contain all the informations about the Missile
(You can’t use any of the functions or variables that start with an “_”)
direction = None¶
The current direction of the missile
(see Direction)
isReady = None¶
Is the missile ready to be use
(see bool)
position = None¶
The current position of the missile
(see Vector2)
